channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Kate Aubusson
item.description: COVID cases linked to Sydney's swelling Crossroads Hotel cluster were infectious within a day or two after they had been infected, leaving contact tracers little time to contain the virus.
item.title: Fears of further spread as Crossroads Hotel virus cases become infectious within a day

item.dc:creator: Tim Barlass
item.description: Clock ticking on three-month refurbishment
item.title: Look no hands as Sydney's GPO clock gets a makeover

item.dc:creator: Tom Rabe
item.description: Sydney's public transport is becoming busier in the outer suburbs but most people are getting into their cars.
item.title: 'It could take years': Slow recovery predicted for public transport

item.dc:creator: Vince Rugari
item.description: The VAR won't be in action for the rest of the A-League regular season, according to an email sent to match officials this week.
item.title: VAR faces axe for A-League return, but could be back for finals

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: The latest report from the Australian Institute of Health and Welfare shows Queenslanders are smoking far less than four years ago but more younger people vape.
item.title: Queenslanders in big smoke butt out but 'vaper' trail is in the air

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: Canterbury legend Chris Anderson denies wielding undue influence at the Bulldogs via his wife and club chair Lynne.
item.title: Chris Anderson slams 'disrespectful' Bulldogs meddling claims

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: The Brisbane medical research facility in a submission to Parliament has suggested it could host such a centre.
item.title: QIMR says it is 'natural home' for Australian disease control headquarters

item.dc:creator: Dana McCauley
item.description: Young Australians are turning away from alcohol, drugs and cigarettes, consuming them less than their parents' generation in a trend that has public health experts baffled.
item.title: Young Australians give drugs and alcohol a miss, vaping on the rise

item.description: Hundreds watched as members of the UNSW Evangelical Union burned copies of student newspaper Tharunka in protest at its campaign challenging pornography laws.
item.title: From the Archives, 1970: UNSW students burn uni paper

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today's interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Thursday, July 16

item.dc:creator: Caitlin Fitzsimmons
item.description: Dipping into superannuation does less damage to retirement living standards than you have been led to believe.
item.title: Early access to superannuation is no disaster

item.dc:creator: Rachel Clun
item.description: While the results of Victoria's genomic sequencing of the outbreaks in Melbourne are kept under wraps, experts and politicians say that information is not as important for NSW.
item.title: How genomic sequencing gives authorities a 'high resolution' understanding of COVID-19 outbreaks

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Thursday, July 16

item.dc:creator: Lucy Battersby
item.description: The global economic shutdown in March has fast-tracked permanent changes in policy, geopolitics, and the global economy, says the world's biggest fund manager.
item.title: Blackrock warns US-China tensions primed to get worse

item.description: The Palace letters expose the role of Australia's then chief justice in the Whitlam Dismissal and cast a pall over judicial independence.
item.title: Whitlam, Kerr and the chief justice ... and the desperation of powers

item.description: So this is how a constitutional monarchy works for a governor-general fearful of losing his job?
item.title: Conduct unbecoming an officer of the Queen

item.dc:creator: Brian Yatman
item.description: Alarms of fire, the convict Robson, miscellaneous notices.
item.title: In the Herald: July 16, 1860

item.description: From the Oxford shirt to a good pair of "dress" sneakers, get to know the wardrobe essentials that are both of-the-moment and a timeless investment.
item.title: What every stylish man knows about getting dressed

item.dc:creator: Rachel Clun
item.description: Within two days of finding separate cases that had been at the pub, the COVID-19 Operations team had found the source of the infection.
item.title: Behind the scenes of tracing the Crossroads Hotel outbreak with the 'war zone detective'

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: Richard Buttrose is starting a new chapter in his Emerald City tale.
item.title: Only in Sydney, Buttrose's next chapter

item.dc:creator: Wendy Tuohy
item.description: A bit like our city's famous weather, the pandemic walk-with-friend often delivers the emotional equivalent of four seasons in one day.
item.title: We're walking through this together: please don't take that away

item.dc:creator: Chris Vedelago
item.description: Among the items stolen from club doctor Ian Stone were written files about the health of St Kilda players, a laptop, a St Kilda FC identity pass and a prescription medication pad.
item.title: St Kilda players' medical files stolen in car smash-and-grab

item.dc:creator: Bob Carr
item.description: If the satellite evidence keeps firming, investors will class gas assets as risky.
item.title: We now know gas is far from the clean fuel it's claimed to be

item.dc:creator: Noel Towell
item.description: Even as he battles to bring "a sense of control" to the pandemic gripping Melbourne, Andrews remains, for now at least, master of his own political destiny.
item.title: Hotels debacle is biting Andrews

item.description: Without an understanding of our shared pasts, Indigenous and non-Indigenous Australia cannot move forward together.
item.title: Truth-telling is the most important step towards reconciliation

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Australians will be offered $2 billion in training subsidies to learn new skills in a program to help job seekers and school-leavers tough out the recession.
item.title: Government's $2 billion 'JobTrainer' plan to help school-leavers and unemployed

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted in the work of our award-winning cartoonists.
item.title: Today's cartoons: The illustrated news

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, July 16, 2020

item.description: If you miss doing this, you really are homesick.
item.title: Chewing the yak fat

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Labor leader Anthony Albanese wants a slow tapering of JobKeeper payments when he starts negotiations with the government ahead of Parliament coming back.
item.title: Labor wants JobKeeper to be slowly tapered, will oppose sudden halt

item.description: The finest photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: The best of the world in pictures

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: University of Queensland's new vice-chancellor, Professor Deborah Terry, returns from Curtin University to take up the role from August 3.
item.title: New vice-chancellor for University of Queensland starts in August

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Cases linked to the Crossroads Hotel outbreak in NSW climbed again on Wednesday, though Queenslanders who came forward for testing have been cleared.
item.title: Queensland hotspot hotel visitors cleared as Premier backs border measures

item.dc:creator: Jake Niall
item.description: Hawthorn president Jeff Kennett does not think Victoria's AFL clubs will suffer long-term damage as a result of the COVID-19 spike that has seen the exodus of all clubs from the state that founded the game.
item.title: Victorian clubs won't be damaged by exodus: Kennett

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: The Players Association has called on fans to respect a players' privacy if they need to return from hubs while arguing that the contract freeze should be lifted if the time between games is reduced.
item.title: Players' association wants contract freeze lifted if season compressed

item.dc:creator: John Silvester
item.description: Shiny new helicopters, high powered police cars and Internet sleuthing are all wonderful additions, but nothing beats boots on the ground.
item.title: Patton wants a police force that takes action

item.dc:creator: John Silvester
item.description: “I don’t want to drive from here to Albury and not see a police car. We prevent crime just by being present.”
item.title: 'Get on with it': New police chief plans more street patrols

item.description: The Tokyo Olympics may have to be postponed again if the novel coronavirus mutates into a stronger pathogen a prominent Japanese government adviser says.
item.title: Tokyo Olympics at risk if coronavirus mutates, gets stronger: adviser

item.dc:creator: Melissa Cunningham
item.description: With elimination of coronavirus in the community unlikely for some time, Melburnians may have to keep their masks handy for years.
item.title: Masks part of the Melbourne look for a long time to come

item.description: The EU Commission had claimed in 2016 that Apple had an illegal sweetheart tax deal with Irish authorities.
item.title: Apple wins EU court case over $21 billion in claimed taxes

item.dc:creator: Chloe Booker
item.description: The proposed Jewish Arts Quarter would aim to showcase the diaspora's "culture, creativity and expression".
item.title: 'Our own Lygon Street': Jewish arts precinct set for Elsternwick

item.dc:creator: Rachael Dexter
item.description: A woman in her 90s has become Victoria's 27th death, while NSW Premier rules out city-wide lockdowns with 13 new cases today.
item.title: As it happened: Victoria records 238 new COVID-19 cases as Crossroads Hotel cluster grows in NSW; Australian death toll stands at 111

item.dc:creator: Andrew Webster
item.description: Trent Barrett's mistakes in three years at Manly could make him the perfect coach for the next three seasons at Canterbury.
item.title: The Zoom call that put Barrett in the box seat for Bulldogs job

item.dc:creator: Sam McClure
item.description: The pregnant partners of St Kilda stars Jarryn Geary and Jake Carlisle, who are both due to give birth in September, could be flown up to hub so they can be together for birth.
item.title: AFL players and their partners juggling hubs and incoming bubs

item.dc:creator: Jewel Topsfield
item.description: A Melbourne freight worker has been linked to the outbreak of COVID-19 at Sydney’s Crossroads Hotel, where the number of positive cases has now swelled to 34.
item.title: Melburnian linked to Sydney's Crossroads Hotel COVID-19 cluster

item.dc:creator: Peter Ryan
item.description: The Cats and the Magpies made two changes each for the historic clash at Optus Stadium on Thursday night.
item.title: De Goey back for Pies as Steven and Clark return for Cats

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: Sydney are prepared to sacrifice some of their home-town support this weekend in the name of safety.
item.title: Safety first for Swans as Victorian clubs move north to Queensland

item.dc:creator: Jenny Noyes
item.description: NSW Health made three crucial mistakes in the handling of the Ruby Princess when it docked in Sydney in March.
item.title: The steps NSW Health should have taken when the Ruby Princess docked

item.dc:creator: Eryk Bagshaw
item.description: Trade Minister Simon Birmingham continues to support the free trade agreement between Australia and Hong Kong despite Washington ending its preferential treatment for the former British colony.
item.title: Australia refuses to join Trump's punishment of China over Hong Kong

item.description: All the ins and outs for round seven of the AFL season, and our experts' tips for the round.
item.title: AFL teams and expert tips, round seven
